v8:item.v8:content: Warning configure in the service picture
For SaaS apps, these settings are configured in the Service Manager by the service administrator.
The new password must: - contain at least 7 characters - contain any 3 out of 4 character types: uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numbers, and special characters - differ from the username
Do this if either of the requirements is not met:
The period from the first use of the password to the moment the password expires.
The period from the first use of the password when the user cannot change the password.
Prevent re-use of this many recent passwords:
Notification lead time before password expires:

Maximum number of inactive days before the user is locked out.
Not applicable to administrators.
The new password must: - contain at least 7 characters - contain any 3 out of 4 character types: uppercase letters, lowercase letters, numbers, and special characters - differ from the username
Do this if either of the requirements is not met:
The period from the first use of the password to the moment the password expires.
The period from the first use of the password when the user cannot change the password.
Prevent re-use of this many recent passwords:
Notification lead time before password expires:

Maximum number of inactive days before the user is locked out.
Not applicable to administrators.
Notify user this many days before access expires:
A user will receive a warning if either the login time restriction is enabled in the user card or the "User inactivity timeout" checkbox is selected in the common settings.
Terminate session if user inactive for:
Allow users to save password on login:
Select the checkbox to let the users seamlessly access the app without requiring manual password entry each time.
Setting "Show in choice list" in user card
Enable and hide for all users
Disable and hide for all users
Note to locking the setting of the Show in list checkbox (external users)
Access is granted for external users, therefore the user list is disabled for security reasons.
Note to locking the setting of the Show in list checkbox (separation is enabled)
The user list is disabled for security reasons.
Use different login settings for external users
Prevent re-use of this many recent passwords:
Setting "Show in choice list" in user card
Use different login settings for external users
Notification lead time before password expires:
Notification lead time before password expires:
Prevent re-use of this many recent passwords:
Terminate session if user inactive for:
Notify user this many days before access expires:
Use standard list of banned passwords
Use additional list of banned passwords
Do this if either of the requirements is not met:
Do this if either of the requirements is not met:
Check whether the confirmation code was sent to the current user's email.
Check whether the invitation to log in was sent to the current user's email.
